meanings.definition: To remove the roof from a building.
meanings.sent1: The workers will unroof the old house to repair the structure.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the strong winds unroofed several houses in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight to see the crew unroofing the building while singing songs.
meanings.sent4: The unroofing of the house revealed a beautiful view of the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The sound of hammers unroofing echoed through the quiet street.

meanings.definition: To expose to the open air by removing a covering.
meanings.sent1: The gardener decided to unroof the plants to let them get more sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The storm's force was so strong that it unroofed the tents at the campsite.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved unroofing a hidden compartment to surprise the audience.
meanings.sent4: The wind unroofed the clouds, revealing a bright blue sky above.
meanings.sent5: The explorer unroofed the ancient tomb, revealing treasures hidden for centuries.

meanings.definition: To uncover or reveal something previously hidden.
meanings.sent1: The detective's investigation finally unroofed the truth behind the mysterious case.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting seemed to unroof the emotions hidden deep within the viewer.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes had the audience laughing so hard they unroofed their hidden joy.
meanings.sent4: The writer's words unroofed the hidden beauty of the ordinary world.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise unroofed the darkness, bringing light to the new day.
